column4: i have a userX that can sudo, but on /etc/sudoers userX isnt there ;o i have a userX that can sudo, but on /etc/sudoers userX isnt there ;o
how do i take him off
ok, i want to add him on sudo to execute only ONE command, like cp /x /y can i do that?
edit /etc/sudoers.  I don't know the syntax offhand, but the manpage for sudoers talks about it (man sudoers)
the redirection is done by your shell which only has your user's rights.  Instead, do echo 1 | sudo tee /blah/blah
echo 1 | sudo  /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward (says command not found, of course :>)
this is a support, about the philosophy :)
it's a known issue on 8.04.  It should go away if you upgrade to 8.10
:// do you know what process i could kill/restart so it would work ?
that's the package that does it.  Just remove it
